title: 'Won't be intimidated by noise made by Trump': Iran after US strikes; says diplomacy not an option
content: The United States launched targeted airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, prompting strong condemnation from Iran, who vowed to continue its nuclear program. President Trump hailed the strikes as a success, warning of further action if Iran doesn't comply with US demands. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu applauded the move, calling it a historic turning point and praising US-Israel cooperation.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: â€˜Key for winningâ€™ AI coding tools is in â€¦.
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke emphasizes the importance of developers retaining hands-on coding skills alongside AI tools. He warns against over-reliance on AI-generated code, advocating for a flexible workflow where developers can seamlessly switch between AI assistance and direct coding.

title: Drama at Headingley! Rishabh Pant loses his cool after umpire denies ball change - WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant, known for his calm demeanor, displayed rare frustration during the Headingley Test when an umpire denied his request to change the ball. Despite the incident, Pant's batting prowess shone as he surpassed Rohit Sharma to become India's leading six-hitter in the World Test Championship.

title: Brittany Mahomes' unexpected night out: Spotted with Travis Kelce, not Patrick
content: Brittany Mahomes enjoyed a concert with Travis Kelce and friends. Patrick Mahomes and Taylor Swift were absent from shared photos. This get-together highlighted the strong bond within the Kansas City Chiefs' circle. It happened after Kelce and Swift's appearance at the Stanley Cup Final. The event showcased the camaraderie beyond football. The Chiefs aim for another championship run.

title: Elon Muskâ€™s simple life: Worldâ€™s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: Iran eyes retaliation after US airstrikes: Key US bases now in crosshairs
content: In a significant escalation, the US has launched airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear sites, including Fordo, Isfahan, and Natanz, using powerful bunker-buster bombs. Iran has warned of a decisive response, raising concerns about regional security. Key US military installations like Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar and the US Navy's Fifth Fleet in Bahrain are potential targets for Iranian retaliation.

title: 'Won't let them sleep': Amit Shah's monsoon mandate for operation against Naxalism
content: Union home minister Amit Shah has issued a stern warning to Naxalites, declaring that anti-Naxal operations will persist through the monsoon season. Shah urged Naxalites to abandon armed struggle and integrate into mainstream society, promising support and fulfillment of commitments from the Chhattisgarh government and the Centre.

title: IND v ENG: 'Actually thought of 3 celebrations': Pant reveals as somersault goes viral
content: Rishabh Pant marked his Test century at Headingley with a memorable somersault, revealing he had other celebrations in mind. His explosive century off 146 balls, including 4 sixes, powered India past 400, aided by a 209-run partnership with Shubman Gill. Pant's return from injury has been remarkable, highlighted by this viral celebration.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Air India flight gets bomb threat: Birmingham to Delhi plane diverted to Riyadh
content: An Air India flight AI114, en route from Birmingham to Delhi on June 21, was diverted to Riyadh after receiving a bomb threat. The aircraft landed safely in Riyadh, where security checks were completed according to an airlines spokesperson. The incident prompted immediate action to ensure the safety of all passengers and crew onboard.

title: 6 â€˜Bunker Busterâ€™, 30 Tomahawk missiles: How US 'destroyed' Iranâ€™s key nuclear sites - details
content: In a sudden turn of events, President Trump authorized precision airstrikes on Iran's key nuclear facilities, marking a significant escalation. The US military targeted Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan using stealth bombers and bunker-buster bombs.

title: Vijay Devarakonda booked for tribals remark; case filed under SC/ST Act
content: Vijay Devarakonda faces legal trouble after allegedly making offensive comments against the tribal community following the Pahalgam terror attack. A case has been registered under the SC/ST Act based on a complaint filed by a tribal community leader.

title: IND vs ENG: Why players are wearing black armbands - who was David Lawrence?
content: India and England cricketers honored David 'Syd' Lawrence, the former England fast bowler, with black armbands. A moment of applause was observed before the start of play at Headingley. Lawrence, who passed away at 61, was remembered for his contributions to cricket. He was the first British-born Black player to represent England.

title: â€˜Attacked with chilli powderâ€™: Man beaten to death by ex-lover and husband in Telangana
content: In a gruesome incident in Nalgonda, Telangana, N Janaiah was brutally murdered by his former lover and her husband. The couple, enraged by Janaiah's continued attempts to contact the woman despite prior warnings and a police complaint, attacked him with chilli powder and sticks.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant's six makes Headingley security official an instant hero â€“ WATCH
content: India amassed 471 runs in their first innings against England. Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, and Yashasvi Jaiswal each scored centuries. Jaiswal and KL Rahul earlier built a strong opening partnership. Gill and Pant then dominated with a 209-run stand. Pant's aggressive innings included six sixes. This was Pantâ€™s seventh Test century, surpassing MS Dhoniâ€™s record.

title: Virat who? Ex-cricketer forgets Virat Kohli's name after Shubman Gill's animated celebration - WATCH
content: Shubman Gill's exuberant celebration after a near dismissal of Joe Root sparked commentary box comparisons to Virat Kohli. Despite the overturned decision, Gill marked his Test captaincy debut with a century, joining an elite list of Indian players. He also reached 2,000 Test runs, mirroring Kohli's achievement in his captaincy debut.

title: 'Gravely concerned': Pak slams US strikes on Iran; day after nominating Trump for Nobel
content: Pakistan strongly condemned US airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, expressing deep concern over escalating tensions in the Middle East. This statement follows Pakistan's recent endorsement of President Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Islamabad urged dialogue and diplomacy to resolve the crisis, emphasizing the need to protect civilian lives.

title: Sunjay Kapur's prayer meet: Karisma & Kareena Kapoor head to Delhi
content: Karisma Kapoor, accompanied by her children Samaira and Kiaan, journeyed to Delhi for the prayer meet of her former husband, Sunjay Kapur, who tragically passed away from a heart attack in London. Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan were also seen at the airport, joining the family to pay their respects at the Taj Palace Hotel.

title: â€˜Highest in 2 yrs': India ups oil imports from Russia, US; strategy over panic amid Iran-Israel war
content: Amidst Iran-Israel tensions, India has significantly increased its Russian oil imports, surpassing combined purchases from Saudi Arabia and Iraq. This shift, driven by discounted prices, sees Russian oil constituting a substantial portion of India's crude imports.

title: Next West Bengal CM or Team India head coach? Ganguly drops a hint
content: Sourav Ganguly has firmly dismissed any interest in entering politics, but remains open to coaching the Indian cricket team in the future. While praising current coach Gautam Gambhir's passion and straightforward approach, Ganguly emphasized the importance of giving Gambhir time to grow in the role.

title: Watch: Smoke rises over Tel Aviv as Iran fires missiles post US strike; several injured
content: Following US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, Tehran launched a missile barrage on Israel, injuring 86. Buildings and vehicles sustained damage, with witnesses reporting a massive explosion. The attack followed Trump's warning of severe consequences for further aggression, while Iranian leaders condemned US involvement, threatening irreparable damage.

title: Chandigarh-Lucknow IndiGo flight cancelled: Pilot reports technical issue
content: An IndiGo flight from Chandigarh to Lucknow was cancelled on Friday due to a technical issue detected before taxiing, ensuring passenger safety through disembarkation. Passengers were accommodated on alternate flights or offered refunds. This incident occurred amidst other aviation disruptions, including an Air India Express flight diversion and an IndiGo flight's emergency landing due to low fuel.

title: Honeymoon murder: Property dealer arrested - how he helped Sonam destroy evidence
content: Indore property dealer, Silom James, has been arrested by Shillong police in connection with the Raja Raghuwanshi murder case. James is accused of stealing items, including a pistol and cash, from a flat used by the victim and an associate. CCTV footage shows James removing a bag from the flat and installing security cameras shortly after the murder.

title: IND vs ENGL 'I played with Kapil Dev but ... ': Ravi Shastri calls Jasprit Bumrah 'greatest' of all time
content: Ravi Shastri has declared Jasprit Bumrah as India's best-ever fast bowler, even surpassing Kapil Dev, highlighting his ability to dismantle any opposition across formats. Shastri compared Bumrah's skill in reading batsmen to that of Malcolm Marshall, noting his improved swing with the new ball.

title: MP shocker: Woman, child kidnapped at gunpoint; police suspect love angle
content: In Chhatarpur district's Sumeri village, a shocking incident occurred. A woman and her child were allegedly abducted. Sanjay Singh Lodhi and his group are the accused. They reportedly fired shots and assaulted the woman's husband, Hariram Prajapati. Police are investigating the case. They are examining a video of the abduction.

title: â€˜Provided food, shelterâ€™: 2 held for aiding Pahalgam attack terrorists; disclose 3 were Pak LeT men
content: NIA apprehended Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar and Bashir Ahmad Jothar for providing shelter and support to LeT terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack. The accused harbored the Pakistani attackers in a seasonal hut before the assault, which targeted tourists in Baisaran Valley based on their religious identity. The duo has been booked under UAPA, and further investigation is under way.

title: Tech vs MBA? Narayana Murthy to young grads; thereâ€™s no real difference; what matters isâ€¦
content: Infosys co-founder NR Narayana Murthy believes that both management and technology graduates hold equal importance in the age of AI. He argues that they approach problem-solving from different angles, with management focusing on 'what' and technology on 'how.' Murthy views AI as a tool that enhances productivity across disciplines, expressing optimism about India's talent pool in both fields.

title: 2 Air India Express flights land without baggage in Patna; flyers promised home delivery
content: Chaos erupted at Patna's Jayprakash Narayan International Airport on Saturday as passengers on two Air India Express flights, IX-2936 from Bengaluru and IX-1634 from Chennai, discovered that their checked baggage was missing. Weary travelers waited in vain at the designated conveyor belts, only to realize none of their luggage had arrived.

title: IND vs ENG: â€˜Same impact as Sir Richard Hadleeâ€™- Manjrekar lauds Bumrah
content: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance, claiming 3/48, stood out amidst India's challenging day against England in the Leeds Test. He dismissed key batsmen, including Zak Crawley, Ben Duckett, and Joe Root. Sanjay Manjrekar lauded Bumrah's impact, comparing him to Sir Richard Hadlee for his ability to consistently create wicket-taking opportunities.

title: ODI World Cup: Ganguly on Kohli and Rohit's future - 'won't be easy'
content: Sourav Ganguly believes it will be challenging for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to maintain fitness and secure spots in India's 2027 ODI World Cup squad, considering their age and limited ODI opportunities. Ganguly acknowledged Kohli's irreplaceable caliber and praised Yuvraj Singh's exceptional white-ball performance, regretting his limited Test opportunities due to a strong batting lineup.

title: Why it's perfectly fine to say 'no'â€”and ways to say it without hurting someone
content: Learning to decline requests is essential for protecting your well-being and priorities. Saying no helps manage stress, set boundaries, and strengthen self-worth, ultimately improving focus and relationships. Politely declining, using techniques like the sandwich method or offering alternatives, allows you to maintain connections while honoring your needs.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Knee in a mess...' - Former India coach recalls Pant's car accident
content: Rishabh Pant's audacious 134 against England in the Leeds Test has drawn high praise. Ravi Shastri lauded Pant's unique approach, describing him as a 'box office' player with his own 'computer' for calculating risks. Pant's recovery from a severe car accident added emotional weight to his innings, celebrated with a somersault.

title: Delhi shocker: Suspecting affair, man murders wife in Paharganj hotel; arrested
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Paharganj, a 24-year-old woman was found murdered in a hotel room, allegedly by her husband who suspected her of infidelity. The husband confessed to the crime after fleeing to Uttar Pradesh, prompting Delhi Police to arrest him.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma opens up about proposing to Ritika Sajdeh - 'It was quite ...'
content: Rohit Sharma shared the details of his romantic proposal to Ritika Sajdeh, recounting how he surprised her at his childhood cricket ground under the guise of getting ice cream. He revealed that he proposed on the pitch, a moment captured by a friend.

title: 'Had the audacity to mourn': CCTV shows Raj at Raja Raghuwanshiâ€™s funeral - video
content: New CCTV footage in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case reveals prime suspect Raj Kushwaha present at the funeral, holding a shroud and garland. He was seen consoling the victim's father while making suspicious phone calls, raising concerns about relaying real-time updates, possibly to Sonam.

title: 'What is the tone?' - Gambhir slammed after Pantâ€™s 'brainfade' dismissal
content: Rishabh Pant's magnificent century at Headingley, surpassing MS Dhoni's record, was marred by a late innings collapse for India. Pant's 134, along with centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, propelled India to 471. However, a sudden loss of wickets saw England's Josh Tongue and Ben Stokes restrict India.

title: Israel-Iran war: What are B-2 bombers used by US to strike Iran? How they work
content: In a dramatic escalation, the United States has directly intervened in the Israel-Iran conflict, with President Trump announcing targeted airstrikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities, including Fordow, Natanz, and Esfahan. The operation, executed with precision, reportedly utilized B-2 Spirit bombers, known for their stealth capabilities and capacity to carry massive ordnance.

title: Mumbaikar instinct kicks in: Flyer misses flight, sprints on runway to board it; arrested
content: In a bizarre incident at Mumbai airport, Piyush Soni, a 25-year-old man, was arrested for trespassing onto the apron after missing his flight to Patna. Security spotted Soni running towards an Air India plane that had arrived from Bhuj, unaware his flight had already departed. He falsely claimed a coach driver dropped him near the runway.

title: Game 7! Everything to know for the Pacers-Thunder finale
content: The Pacers and Thunder face off in a Game 7 season finale. Here's everything you need to know for the winner-take-all showdown.

title: Anderson's shutout has LSU on brink of MCWS title
content: Kade Anderson pitched a three-hitter as LSU moved within a win of its second national championship in three years with a 1-0 victory over Coastal Carolina.

title: Jones, 37, retires; White: Aspinall now champion
content: Jon Jones, 37, widely considered the greatest mixed martial artist of all time, has retired, UFC CEO Dana White announced Saturday and the heavyweight later confirmed on social media, saying the decision came "after a lot of reflection."

title: Devers goes deep vs. Red Sox, downplays homer
content: Rafael Devers' first home run as a Giant came against his former teammates in Boston, but he said it was "nothing more special than any other home run that I've hit."

title: Sources: Bucks' Connaughton picks up option
content: Bucks guard Pat Connaughton has exercised his $9.4 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Extreme heat ails Reds' De La Cruz, M's Thornton
content: Reds shortstop Elly De La Cruz and Mariners reliever Trent Thornton fell ill while playing in temperatures that exceeded 90 degrees.

title: Fleetwood atop Travelers as 1st tour win in sight
content: Tommy Fleetwood never missed a fairway and seized on the good scoring conditions for a 7-under 63 and a three-shot lead going into the final round of the Travelers Championship.

title: Reds prospect Burns will make MLB debut Tuesday
content: Chase Burns, 22, the No. 2 overall pick in the 2024 MLB draft who has excelled at three levels of the minor leagues this season, will be promoted so he can make his major league debut for the Reds on Tuesday against the Yankees.

title: Liberty's Jones out 4-6 weeks with ankle sprain
content: Liberty center Jonquel Jones, the 2021 WNBA MVP and Finals MVP in 2024, will miss four to six weeks with a right ankle sprain, the team announced. But after further imaging and evaluation, she avoided long-term injury.

content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial Â£100m.

title: USMNT's Wright (Achilles) out for rest of Gold Cup
content: USMNT forward Haji Wright has been ruled out for the remainder of the Concacaf Gold Cup with an Achilles injury, U.S. Soccer announced on Saturday.

title: Jobe Bellingham: First Dortmund goal 'surreal'
content: Jobe Bellingham said his first goal for Borussia Dortmund was a surreal experience as the new signing made an immediate impact at the Club World Cup.

title: Pep: Some City players will be 'sad' if they stay
content: Pep Guardiola has suggested he will slim down his Manchester City squad before the end of the transfer window to avoid having "sad" players next season.

title: Inter snatch late win to break Urawa Reds' hearts
content: Valentin Carboni scored in the second minute of second-half stoppage time to complete Inter Milan's rally to a 2-1 victory over Urawa Red Diamonds.

title: Cazorla helps Oviedo end 24-year LaLiga absence
content: Real Oviedo sealed their return to LaLiga after 24 years with a 3-2 aggregate victory over Mirandes in Saturday's promotion play-off.

title: Frimpong: Wirtz makes Liverpool move 'extra fun'
content: Jeremie Frimpong has told ESPN the arrival of Florian Wirtz, his former Bayer Leverkusen teammate, at Liverpool has made his move "extra fun."

title: Sources: Onana wants Man Utd stay this summer
content: AndrÃ© Onana is keen to stay at Manchester United despite interest from Monaco, sources have told ESPN.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

content: Chelsea have entered the race to sign Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: "Devastated Iran's Nuclear Programme": Pentagon Chief On Op Midnight Hammer
content: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth today said that the United States strikes on key sites in Iran has completely "devastated the Iranian nuclear programme."

title: "Reiterated Our Call For De-escalation": PM Modi Speaks To Iran President
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian today and expressed concern at the recent escalations in the Iran-Israel conflict.

title: Op 'Midnight Hammer': How US Bombed Iran's 3 Nuclear Facilities
content: The US military today explained how exactly the operation to bomb three nuclear sites in Iran unfolded. B-2 stealth aircraft dropped bunker-buster bombs on a fortified nuclear facility, while submarine-launched cruise missiles hit two other sites.

title: Bahrain And Kuwait Prepare For Spillover As US-Iran Conflict Escalates
content: Bahrain and Kuwait, home to US bases, made preparations on Sunday for the possibility the Iran conflict might spread to their territory, with Bahrain urging drivers to avoid main roads and Kuwait establishing shelters in a ministries complex.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: US Strikes Against Iran Nuclear Facilities 'Incredible And Overwhelming Success,' Pentagon Chief Says
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: The United States on Sunday carried out a "very successful attack" on three nuclear sites in Iran, President Donald Trump said late on Saturday.

title: Family Brings Home Body Of Manipur Flight Attendant, Hundreds Pay Tributes
content: The body of 20-year-old Kongbrailatpam Nganthoi Sharma, a flight attendant from Manipur who was killed in the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, was brought to Imphal today.

title: 2003 vs 2025: Why Americans Aren't Rallying Behind War Against Iran
content: It was March 2003 when the United States invaded Iraq with the backing of a largely supportive public. Images of "shock and awe" lit up TV screens as American patriotism surged in the wake of 9/11. Polls showed broad approval for the war.

title: Door-To-Door Electoral Roll Verification Likely Before Bihar Polls: Sources
content: The Election Commission of India is contemplating intensive door-to-door verification during revision of electoral rolls for upcoming Bihar assembly polls, sources in the Commission said.

title: "Mysterious" Messages Greet Callers On Iranian Numbers Amid Israel Conflict
content: Amid Iran's ongoing conflict with Israel, Iranians living abroad are encountering eerie disruptions while trying to call friends and family back home.

title: Post-Strike Images At Fordow Nuclear Site Show Damage After US Bombed Iran
content: The entire Fordow plant is underneath the mountain site; there are no overt structures or chimneys because the whole nuclear reactor is underground, which is why the United States had to penetrate into it with bunker-buster weaponry.

title: Iran's Nuclear Programme: From 1950s Origins To 2025 Destruction
content: A week after Israel launched an unprecedented attack against Iran over fears about its nuclear ambitions, US strikes overnight on Sunday on three Iranian nuclear sites have further ramped up the dispute.

title: Reza Shah, Son Of Iran's Last Shah, Asks Ayatollah Khamenei To "Step Down" After US Attack
content: Reza Pahlavi, the exiled son of the last Shah of Iran, Mohammad Reza Shah, claimed on Sunday that US strikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities were a result of "catastrophic pursuit of nuclear weapons" by Ali Khamenei's "terrorist regime."

title: Many Nations Ready To Supply Iran With Their Nuclear Warheads: Top Putin Aide
content: Iran Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi will reportedly meet Russian President Vladimir Putin tomorrow, amid escalating tensions in the Middle East.

title: Air India Flight From UK's Birmingham To Delhi Diverted To Riyadh After Hoax Bomb Threat
content: An Air India flight from Birmingham to Delhi was diverted to Riyadh on Friday after receiving a bomb threat mid-air.

title: Video: Israel Destroys Iranian F-5 Fighter Jets At Airport
content: The Israeli forces on Saturday struck a dozen of military targets in Iran, including two F-5 fighter jets at the Dezful Airport, in the Islamic country's Khuzestan province.

title: Iran Uses Its Biggest Missile To Strike Israel After US Bombing
content: Iran reportedly used its biggest missile capable of carrying the heaviest payload in its attacks on Israel, hours after US bomber jets struck three nuclear facilities that are believed to be nurturing Tehran's nuclear ambitions.

title: Iran, Israel Trade New Strikes As US Bombs Iranian Nuclear Sites
content: Iran and Israel exchanged new strikes after the US bombed three Iranian nuclear sites - Natanz, Isfahan and Fordow.

title: The 'Peacemaker' Who Struck First: How Trump Abandoned His Anti-War Crusade
content: A day after blasting the Nobel Committee for ignoring his anti-war legacy, US President Donald Trump ordered "spectacular" airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan, shattering his long-crafted image as a peacemaker.

content: In the immediate aftermath of Sunday morning's Iranian missile strikes on Israel, while sirens blared and residents took shelter, a different kind of mobilisation began in parallel.

content: the NBA offseason has officially arrived . there are massive storylines yet to resolve, including the Los Angeles Lakers sale . the NBA draft is just days away, and free agency just days after that . here are five trades featuring 10 different teams .

title: 'Best pitcher on the planet': Anderson's historic outing has LSU one win from title
content: Kade Anderson strikes out 10 in game 1 of men's college world series finals . the 20-year-old threw only the second complete game of his collegiate career . he also shutout just the third complete game shutout seen in the current 22-year era .

title: Draft regulations on renewable energy: Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission to hold online hearings in July
content: Virtual hearings will be held from July 8 to July 11. Commission says online mode will guarantee greater stakeholder participation from across the State

title: Kalikuppam residents seek urgent repair to damaged community hall and anganwadi
content: The two facilities were constructed in 2008 by a New Delhi-based trust as part of post-tsunami relief effort but have since fallen into disuse because of lack of maintenance

title: Sewage lifting station to come up in Khajamalai in Tiruchi
content: It is expected to rectify the design flaws in the sewer network which has pipes that are more than 20 years old and were laid uneven causing frequent blockages and bursts

title: Youthâ€™s â€˜detention and assaultâ€™ in police custody triggers row at Kadiri in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The youthâ€™s mother and grandmother accuse sub-inspector of manhandling them for questioning the â€˜injusticeâ€™, stage dharna along with kin; Superintendent of Police orders inquiry into the incident

title: Air India to temporarily reduce flights operated with narrow-body planes on 19 routes
content: "This voluntary decision leads to the temporary suspension of Air India's services on 3 routes and reduction of frequency on 19 routes. The changes are effective until at least 15 July 2025," it said.

title: Permanent library building nearing completion in Kilvelur taluk
content: The new building will have a dedicated study area for students preparing to write the TNPSC and UPSC examinations

title: CBFC demands name change for JSK- Janaki Vs State of Kerala, starring Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: When the Thiruvananthapuram office of the CBFC cleared the film and forwarded it to the headquarters in Mumbai, the officials there demanded a change in the title and the name of the titular character of Janaki, apparently because the name also refers to the Hindu goddess Sita. Director says the changes will do immense damage to the film

title: Water release slows down bridge construction across the Cauvery in Tiruchi
content: State Highways Department, however, says work has not been suspended entirely as some work on the riverbed closer to the left bank and off site work will continue

title: Dravidian University in Kuppam faces backlash for selling trees, sparking environmental concerns
content: Severe financial crunch along with poor financial support from the governments of Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Kerala forced the university administration to resort to felling of trees at least to generate minimum funds, says an official

title: INS Nilgiri joins Eastern Naval Commamd in Visakhapatnam
content: Built in Mumbai, INS Nilgiri now makes the City of Destiny her home port; this state of the art warship is driven by her motto â€” â€œAdrish Yabalam, Ajeya Shauryamâ€.

title: Yoga at 105: This Belagavi centenarian is an inspiration to the young
content: At 105 years of age, Belagavi-based Gandhian and freedom fighter Rajendra Kalaghatagi practices asanas and pranayama everyday.Â

title: Delhi-Birmingham flight diverted to Riyadh following bomb threat: Air India
content: In a statement on Sunday, June 22, the Tata Group-owned airline, which has temporarily reduced services ensure operational stability, said alternative arrangements are being made to fly the passengers from Riyadh to their destinations.

title: Amit Shah lays foundation stones for NFSU campus, Central Forensic Science Lab in Nava Raipur
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the Central Forensic Science Lab will come up on 6-7 acres of land near the National Forensic Science University campus

title: PM Modi calls for â€˜immediate de-escalationâ€™ after U.S. bombs Fordow, Natanz, Esfahan nuclear sites in Iran
content: India is a strategic partner of Iran and the two sides have been engaged closely to ensure safety of Indian citizens in Iran, as the west Asian conflict escalated on 13 June.

title: Ahmedabad crash victim's mortal remains reach Manipur, thousands pay tributes
content: A cousin of Nganthoi Sharma said that airport officials, family members and others paid floral tributes to her mortal remains after it was brought to Imphal airport aboard an IndiGo flight.

title: Monsoon advances in parts of Punjab
content: "Conditions are favourable for its further advancement in parts of Haryana, including Chandigarh, over the next two days," Chandigarh Meteorological Department Director Surinder Pal said

title: Woman, her minor children abducted at gunpoint from M.P. found in Haryana; prime accused, six others held
content: The alleged abduction took place on Saturday in Chhatarpurâ€™s Sumedi village, underÂ Lavkushnagar police station limits, when about a dozen men, carrying firearms and sticks, took the woman and her daughters

title: Alleged extortion of â‚¹2.51 crore: Police officer placed under suspension
content: The action was initiated by the Ministry of Home (Kerala) on the basis of a report submitted by the State Police Chief

title: Cauvery Neeravari Nigama Ltd. rules out threat to safety of Kabini reservoir
content: Contrary to media claims, water is not gushing out and only mild seepage has been observed; the alarming news shown on some online platforms is far from the truth: CNNL statement

title: Maharashtraâ€™s dichotomy in not taking action against illegal structures evident, unacceptable: Bombay HC
content: Bombay High Court orders demolition of illegal structure, criticises inactions by authorities, and calls for accountability and prosecution

title: Karnataka SC survey: Flawed population projection, urban apathy, migration could be reasons for poor response in Bengaluru
content: While the estimated population of SCs in the erstwhile BBMP (now Greater Bengaluru Area) is 13.62 lakh, 6.62 lakh persons have been enumerated so far in the survey that commenced on May 5.

title: Uncertainty dogs mango business in erstwhile Chittoor district of A.P.
content: In view of the spurt in supply and the resultant fall in price, and factories expressing reluctance to procure the fruits led to increased waiting time for the trucks and tractors, which means an additional rent burden for the farmers

title: Puri Rath yatra: East Coast Railway announces special trains
content: The special trains are: 08313 Visakhapatnam-Puri special train via Haripurgram, Arugul will leave Visakhapatnam at 00.45 hours on June 27 and on July 5 (past midnight of June 26 and July 4)

title: ED raids Himachal Assistant Drug Controller, linked persons in PMLA probe
content: Nishant Sareen, during the Himachal Police investigation, faced charges of receiving bribe from pharmaceutical companies based in Baddi, a pharma hub in the State

title: Engaging with States to ensure effective implementation of UMEED portal for Waqf properties: Minority Affairs Ministry
content: Ministry actively engages with States to implement UMEED portal, ensuring all Waqf properties are uploaded within six months

title: Israel-Iran conflict affects Indiaâ€™s diplomatic calendar, Egyptian Foreign Minister â€˜postponesâ€™ India visit
content: The Ministry of External Affairs had announced the visit of Mr. Abdelatty on Saturday, but against the backdrop of regional tension, sources informed on Sunday that the visit will not take place this week

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Meghalaya Police arrests two persons in Madhya Pradesh
content: The SIT on Saturday night arrested a property dealer for concealing a box belonging to Raghuvanshiâ€™s wife Sonam, who hid it in a flat in Indore after the murder last month

title: Punjab terror case: NIA chargesheets key aide of Khalistani terrorists
content: Jatinder Singh, hailing from Gurdaspur district of Punjab, was arrested by the NIA from Mumbai on December 23, last year, in the case, according to an official statement

title: Polling underway in 3,894 gram panchayats in Gujarat
content: The State Election Commission (SEC) said 81 lakh voters are eligible to exercise their franchise to elect 3,656 sarpanchs and 16,224 panchayat members

title: Woman pilot harassed during cab ride in Mumbai; three men booked
content: The incident took place around 11.15 p.m. on June 19, 2025 when the woman was heading back to her house in Ghatkopar from south Mumbai.

title: Political succession in Andhra Pradeshâ€™s SPSR Nellore district sees next generation leaders emerging

content: The accused have been identified as Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar from Batkote, Pahalgam, and Bashir Ahmad Jothar of Hill Park, Pahalgam

title: Iran-Israel War: India ramps up oil imports from Russia, U.S. in June
content: The U.S. military struck three sites in Iran early Sunday, directly joining Israel which first struck Iranian nuclear sites on June 13.

title: Speed limit likely to rise for heavy vehicles on Mumbai-Pune Expresswayâ€™s ghat stretch
content: The current speed limit of 60 kmph for cars in the 10-km ghat section is unlikely to be changed. On other stretches of the countryâ€™s first access-controlled expressway, the speed limit is 100 kmph for smaller vehicles and 80 kmph for heavy vehicles

title: Himachal CM Sukhu directs firm action against developers for undue delay in hydropower projects
content: The Chief Minister asserted that undue delay in the project execution are causing significant losses to the State exchequer

title: Two arrested for allegedly assaulting and abusing Dalit lawyer
content: A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media, and the public demanded immediate action.

title: Tamil Nadu teenager kidnap case: Love, abduction and trial of an ADGP
content: While the abduction of an 18-year-old young man from a village inÂ Tiruvallur went unnoticed, what happened later grabbed the headlines. Following up on a case filed by the mother of the boy, the police said their investigation had revealed the involvement of anÂ MLA, a former SI and even a senior IPS officer.Â R.Â Sivaraman examines the many twists and turns the case underwent before the Supreme Court stepped in.

title: Whatâ€™s the biggest challenge in DNA analysis? | Explained
